meanings.definition: An instrument that indicates the time by the position of the shadow cast by the sun's rays on a plate or surface.
meanings.sent1: The sundials in the park helped people know when it was noon.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the sundials in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the sundials as a stage for its acorn performances.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to slow down as if the sundials held the sun in place.
meanings.sent5: The sundials stood like silent guardians, marking the passage of time with their shadows.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure time by the position of the sun in the sky.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization relied on sundials to schedule their daily activities.
meanings.sent2: Tourists marveled at the historical sundials displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The sundials at the beach seemed to play hide and seek with the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile brightened the room like the sun on a sundial.
meanings.sent5: The sundials' accuracy was unmatched, guiding travelers through the day.
